intro: Eriolepis italica, commonly known as the Italian eriolepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has smooth, succulent stems and broad, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in warm, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
